title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls are open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. in 275 precincts for the municipal election.
Mayor Michelle Wu is running unopposed while most Boston City Council races are contested.
Printed ballots are available in English, Spanish, Chinese, and Vietnamese; assistance offered in multiple additional languages.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins' second line, featuring Pavel Zacha, Casey Mittelstadt, and Viktor Arvidsson, helped secure a 2-1 win over the Hurricanes.
Head coach Marco Sturm praised Casey Mittelstadt for contributing significantly after returning from being benched earlier in the season.
The effective performance of the second line is crucial as the Bruins manage without top forward Elias Lindholm.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox pitcher Garrett Crochet is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award, leading with 205.1 innings and 255 strikeouts.
Crochet posted an 18-5 record with a 2.59 ERA in his first season, aiding Boston's playoff win over the Yankees.
Roman Anthony, also from the Red Sox, is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year after posting a .292 average in 71 games.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are prioritizing another edge rusher with Arden Key as a potential target ahead of the NFL trade deadline.
Needs include running back depth due to injuries to Antonio Gibson and Rhamondre Stevenson, with Jerome Ford as a possible acquisition.
The team's current secondary and linebacking corps are thin, requiring depth to support ongoing on-field success and mitigate injuries.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye has been sacked 34 times this season, second-most in the NFL.
The New England offensive line issues stem from starting rookies and new positions, contributing to high sack numbers.
Maye has tied his sack total from last season despite playing four fewer games, highlighting protection and decision challenges.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel settled a discrimination complaint involving Ansley Baker, accused of being male, with a $10,000 donation and policy updates.
The Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination found the hotel stereotyped and harassed Baker, prompting her lawyer to plan a civil lawsuit.
The hotel agreed to anti-discrimination training for staff, with changes in policies and a public non-discrimination statement in the lobby.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons head coach Raheem Morris walked back accusations that Patriots simulated snap counts during a 24-23 loss.
Morris initially claimed Patriots mimicked Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clapping, leading to an early snap and penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel refuted accusations, attributing any confusion to the crowd's energy, dismissing 'clapgate' concerns.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of his contract with the Boston Red Sox to pursue free agency this offseason.
Bregman had $80 million left on his deal with opt-out clauses allowing him to seek a longer contract.
The Red Sox may attempt to re-sign Bregman amidst interest from teams like the Tigers and Mariners.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots consider upgrades before NFL trade deadline with key positions needing reinforcement.
Coach Mike Vrabel indicates the Patriots may pursue trades if beneficial for present and future successes.
Patriots reportedly exploring trade options for OLB Anfernee Jennings amid deadline activity.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and his fiancée welcomed their first child, Magnolia, last week.
Lindholm returned to the Bruins lineup after a lower-body injury; the team is 5-1-0 with him playing.
Coach Marco Sturm emphasizes Lindholm's impact on-ice and in the locker room, boosting defensive performance.
